Frank McCown wrote:
>
> I have recently completed some modifications to Heritrix 1.9 that allow
> users to see a crawl report and seed report for completed crawl jobs.
> Currently if the user tries to view these reports, they are given a "No
> statistics associated with job" message.
>
> I've got example pages available here to look at (click on links under
> Enhancements):
>
> http://www.cs.odu.edu/~fmccown/heritrix/ 
> <http://www.cs.odu.edu/%7Efmccown/heritrix/>
>
> If you guys would like to incorporate this functionality into Heritrix,
> let me know.
>
> You'll notice that I separated DNS entries from HTTP crawl data. This
> better suits my needs, but perhaps others would prefer it together?
> Also I added a TLD distribution.
>
> I would appreciate any feedback you all might have.
>


















Looks great Frank. Would be sweet addition to Heritrix.  Send over a 
patch so we can take a look at whats involved integrating. 

Otherwise:

+ Separating DNS from HTTP seems like it would make for easier reading.  
HTTPS is mixed in with HTTP I assume?
+ In crawl_report1.html, the 'Status code', 'MIME type', and 'Hosts' 
column members are clickable and take me to what looks like a page that 
will draw out a grep of log content?  Is that right?
+ In 'seeds_report.html', the 'Status code and Disposition' column has 
the description text as links taking me to the grep-of-logs page. Is 
that what you intended?  (I like the feature where you mix in the 
redirect page as a link so can take a quick look at where the crawler 
was directed).

Good stuff,
St.Ack






>
> Thanks,
> Frank
>
>
